Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren’t
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'
Octopuses have three hearts and their blood is blue
Wombat poop is cube-shaped — it helps prevent it from rolling away
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists found pots of it in Egyptian tombs that were still edible
Sharks are older than trees — they’ve been around for 400 million years
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus
The Eiffel Tower can grow more than 6 inches in summer due to heat expansion
There’s a basketball court on the top floor of the U.S. Supreme Court building — it's nicknamed the 'Highest Court in the Land'
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins — up to 40 minutes
Some cats are allergic to humans (though it's rare)
Butterflies can taste with their feet
The moon has moonquakes, similar to earthquakes
A jiffy is an actual unit of time — about 1/100th of a second
Scotland’s national animal is a unicorn
There are more fake flamingos in the world than real ones
Koalas have fingerprints so similar to humans that they can confuse crime scenes
A shrimp's heart is in its head
You can hear a blue whale's heartbeat from over 2 miles away
Turtles can breathe through their butts — it’s called cloacal respiration
Cows have best friends and can become stressed when they are separated
A group of owls is called a parliament
The Eiffel Tower can be 15 cm taller during the summer due to thermal expansion
The average person laughs about 15 times a day
A single cloud can weigh as much as 1 million pounds
Your taste buds have a lifespan of about 10 to 14 days
The longest recorded hiccuping lasted for 68 years
Bees can recognize human faces
The world's largest desert is Antarctica
The dot over the letter 'i' is called a tittle
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar, lasting only 38 minutes
The smell of freshly-cut grass is actually a plant distress call
Elephants are the only animals that can't jump
There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the observable universe
The world's oldest toy is a stick, according to archaeological finds
